An ECHO grant to respond to the recent displacement of IDPs in Ethiopia

Anticipated risk (cyclical displacement being exacerbated by the COVID-19 situation): Three of the COVID19 high-risk districts are among the most vulnerable regions to receive high concentration of rainfall during the South-west monsoon season between May to September. 45% of the flood as well as landslide affected persons since 2014 are from these 03 districts. Present lockdown and travel restrictions have severely impacted coordination between the actors and preparation efforts on all levels. Shortage of facilities in safe centres (designated and not designated/communal ones) impacts on a family's decision to evacuate because of the fear of being infected with COVID19 and they might decide to stay at homes taking the risk of their own lives.

ARC Replica is an insurer in Senegal, they have agreed a payout to WV Senegal of $1.3m to respond to the drought. The payout is being managed by Start Network in the UK and the flow of funds will come from Start to WVUK to WV Senegal

A research project on disaster programming in urban environments. IRC is consortium lead and holds agreement with IIED (the donor, funded through DfID). IRC is funding WVI, through WVUK, to deliver a research component of the project. WVUK to hold sub-agreement with IRC, and then pass funds on to WVI to implement project deliverables
A shelter/NFI cash project to respond to the displacement in West Guji. CRS is the lead agency and WV are a sub to them.
Assistance to 375 most vulnerable households in Union Councils Bhugra Memon, Serani, Kadhan, Tehsil Badin, Badin district, Southern Sindh Province,

Beneficiairy Registration for 213131 WFP project. Improves revenue recognition. This accompanies 213291 only $190 match to register the beneficiareis of 213291 Moz. No beneficiries as they are covered on 213291.

BEWAP - Bulawayo Emergency Water Augmentation Project
Ensuring the health and wellbeing of the residents of Bulawayo, particularly the vulnerable, disabled, elderly, and those in unserved areas, by ensuring the maximum use of limited existing water and sanitation resources ;
Building 75 blocks of classrooms, latrine and well rehabilitation to reduce overcrowding in schools and get children back into education post civil war and Ebola
